conflictDescription: User Story A requires ALFRED to automatically monitor cognitive games without patient consent, while User Story B mandates respecting patient privacy and autonomy during video call check-ins, implying that monitoring without consent is forbidden. This creates a contradiction about performing monitoring operations under privacy constraints.
userStoryASummary: As a medical caregiver, I want ALFRED to monitor cognitive game progress automatically without patient consent, so I can maintain clinical oversight without delays.
userStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver managing multiple clients, I want to send video call requests to check their well-being while ensuring their privacy and autonomy are fully respected.
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to respect patient consent and privacy by enabling automatic cognitive game monitoring only with explicit consent while ensuring video call check-ins fully respect autonomy.
newUserStoryASummary: As a medical caregiver, I want ALFRED to monitor cognitive game progress automatically with patient consent, so I can maintain clinical oversight respectfully.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to send video call requests respecting patient privacy and autonomy, so that well-being is checked with full consent.
